questions.text:
What does the game Pokemon Go show about algorithms?

Notes:

  • Pokemon Go - 2016.
  • Augmented reality placed digital creatures in real locations
  • Millions of users travelled to catch them - changed how people moved / behaved

Businesses became involved. What was the effect?

Notes:

  • Businesses paid for placement to attract players
  • Problems: overcrowding / environment
  • Ethical concerns: manipulation vs entertainment

Is this effect only limited to games?

Notes:

  • Not just games: algorithms rank / filter digital content
  • Algorithms become gatekeepers of knowledge
  • Affects people's understanding of the world

How was knowledge managed in the past, and what was the vision for the future?

Notes:

  • Past: humans managed access to content
  • Dreamed of universal open access to knowledge via techn
  • BUT... didn't consider bias / manipulation

What are the challenges for technology in reality

Notes:

  • Multiple challenges: filter bubbles, lack of diversity, censorship, algorithmic nudgement vs human intelligence

What is the core issue?

Notes:

  • Ensuring that human values are kept
  • Tech intended to expand access to info could reshape society in unintended ways
